events.event_name: Bank of England Interest Rate Decision
events.description: The Bank of England left interest rates unchanged with a narrow 5–4 vote to hold.

events.event_name: Appointment of Peter Mandelson as UK Ambassador
events.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer appointed Peter Mandelson as UK ambassador to the US, causing political scrutiny.

facts.fact_text: Sterling edged back toward $1.36 at the end of the week.

evidences.evidence_text: Sterling edged back toward $1.36 at the end of a volatile week

facts.fact_text: The Bank of England left interest rates unchanged.

evidences.evidence_text: On the policy front, the BoE left interest rates unchanged

facts.fact_text: The BoE vote to hold rates was 5–4.

evidences.evidence_text: surprised markets with a narrow 5–4 vote to hold

facts.fact_text: Four MPC members supported an immediate 25 bp cut.

evidences.evidence_text: Four MPC members supported an immediate 25 bp cut

claims.claim_text: Sterling is on track for its sharpest weekly decline against the dollar since late October.

evidences.evidence_text: put sterling on track for its sharpest weekly decline against the dollar since late October

claims.claim_text: Political uncertainty flared due to the appointment of Peter Mandelson.

evidences.evidence_text: Sterling came under pressure as political uncertainty flared on Thursday, with questions raised over the durability of Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s leadership following his appointment of Peter Mandelson

claims.claim_text: Inflation will fall back toward the 2% target from April.
claims.author: Four MPC members

evidences.evidence_text: citing expectations that inflation will fall back toward the 2% target from April

claims.claim_text: Risks from persistent inflation have eased.
claims.author: Bank of England

evidences.evidence_text: The Bank noted that risks from persistent inflation have eased

claims.claim_text: Downside risks from weaker demand and a softening labor market have become more pronounced.
claims.author: Bank of England

evidences.evidence_text: downside risks from weaker demand and a softening labor market have become more pronounced
